criteria.description: Establishes a strong historical context including time, place, and broader historical events or developments, with a clear link to the prompt (e.g., 'which allowed for', 'which led to').
Provides some historical context, but the link to broader historical events or developments is unclear or weak.
Attempts to provide historical context, but lacks clarity or relevance to the prompt.
Minimal or no historical context provided; context is unrelated to the prompt.
Makes a historically defensible claim that directly answers all parts of the prompt using specific terms from the prompt, without merely restating the question.
Makes a claim that addresses the prompt, but may be overly vague or only partially answers the question.
Makes a general claim, but does not directly answer all parts of the prompt or uses vague terms.
Thesis is unclear or does not address the prompt.
Includes at least 3 pieces of historical evidence related to the topic of the essay/prompt.
Includes 2 pieces of historical evidence related to the topic of the essay/prompt.
Includes 1 piece of historical evidence related to the topic of the essay/prompt.
No relevant historical evidence included.
Uses at least two additional historical examples to support a multi-part argument in response to the prompt.
Uses one historical example to support a multi-part argument, or two examples that are only loosely related to the argument.
Attempts to support the argument with historical examples, but they are poorly chosen or unclear.
Does not use historical examples to support the argument.
Uses historical reasoning (Comparison, Causation, or CCOT) to frame an argument throughout multiple body paragraphs, with clear topic sentences addressing the prompt.
Uses historical reasoning, but it is inconsistent or only partially addresses the prompt through topic sentences or body paragraphs.
Attempts to use historical reasoning, but it lacks clarity or relevance to the argument and topic sentences.
No clear use of historical reasoning in framing the argument.
